description: "Varney's Midwifery is the gold standard for midwifery practice. Completely updated and revised, it reflects current evidence-based guidelines. The Sixth Edition addresses care of women throughout the lifespan, including primary care, gynecology, newborn care, and maternity care in a variety of birth settings. With chapters written by expert midwives with an emphasis on anatomy and physiology, this text will assist students and midwives in providing healthcare services for women today. In addition, chapter appendices are designed to help students, midwives, and international readers learn essential skills. These critical skills include vulvar biopsy, insertion of contraceptive devices, hand maneuvers for birth, management of a fetus in a breech presentation, and current evidence-based steps for managing postpartum hemorrhage"--Publisher's description
contributor: King, Tekoa L., editor.$$QKing, Tekoa L.
Brucker, Mary C., editor.$$QBrucker, Mary C.
contents: Part I: Midwifery. History of midwifery in the united states -- Professional midwifery today -- Midwifery: clients, context, and care -- Part II: Midwives as primary care providers. Introduction to the care of women -- Health promotion across the lifespan -- Common conditions in primary care -- Nutrition -- Mental health conditions -- Pharmacotherapeutics -- Part III: Gynecology. Anatomy and physiology of the female reproductive system -- Menstrual cycle abnormalities -- Gynecologic disorders -- Breast conditions -- Reproductive tract and sexually transmitted infections -- Family planning -- Nonhormonal contraception -- Hormonal contraception -- Midlife, menopause, and beyond -- Part IV: Antepartum. Anatomy and physiology of pregnancy -- Genetics -- Prenatal care -- Pregnancy-related conditions -- Medical complications in pregnancy -- Part V: Intrapartum. Anatomy and physiology during labor and birth -- First stage of labor -- Fetal assessment during labor -- Support for women during labor -- Second stage of labor and birth -- Complications during labor and birth -- Third stage of labor -- Birth in the home and birth center -- Part VI: Postpartum. Anatomy and physiology of postpartum -- Postpartum care -- Postpartum complications -- Breastfeeding and the mother-newborn dyad -- Part VII: Newborn. Anatomy and physiology of the newborn -- Examination of the newborn -- Neonatal care.
